meanings.definition: Incorrect or improper use of something.
meanings.sent1: The misemployment of the hammer as a screwdriver caused damage to the furniture.
meanings.sent2: The misemployment of company funds for personal expenses led to an investigation.
meanings.sent3: His misemployment of the vacuum cleaner as a leaf blower resulted in a messy backyard.
meanings.sent4: The misemployment of her kindness as a sign of weakness was a grave mistake.
meanings.sent5: The misemployment of the fire extinguisher as a prop in the play was a dangerous choice.

meanings.definition: The act of using something in a way that is not suitable or appropriate.
meanings.sent1: The misemployment of the word 'literally' in that context was confusing.
meanings.sent2: Her misemployment of the office printer for personal projects caused delays.
meanings.sent3: The misemployment of the umbrella as a walking stick was comical.
meanings.sent4: His misemployment of time as if it were endless was a regrettable oversight.
meanings.sent5: The misemployment of the emergency phone for non-urgent calls was irresponsible.
